intro: Ghinia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Ghinia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and botanical collections.
